qas.question: What were Harlan and Stewart's party affiliations?
What party did Brennan belong to?
Who did Eisenhower nominate for Chief Justice?
What sort of decisions did Warren favor on the Supreme Court?
Along with liberals, who was Eisenhower trying to appeal to with the Warren pick?

context: Whittaker was unsuited for the role and soon retired. Stewart and Harlan were conservative <a0_0>Republicans<a0_0/>, while Brennan was a <a1_0>Democrat<a1_0/> who became a leading voice for liberalism. In selecting a Chief Justice, Eisenhower looked for an experienced jurist who could appeal to liberals in the party as well as <a4_0>law-and-order conservatives<a4_0/>, noting privately that <a2_0>Warren<a2_0/> "represents the kind of political, economic, and social thinking that I believe we need on the Supreme Court ... He has a national name for integrity, uprightness, and courage that, again, I believe we need on the Court". In the next few years Warren led the Court in a series of <a3_0>liberal<a3_0/> decisions that revolutionized the role of the Court.
